input_text:
Job Title: Civil Structural Engineer

Location: Lewisville, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Eagle Tech Consultants is hiring for an Applications Engineer. 
A Structural Applications Engineer is a professional who specializes in designing, analyzing, and implementing structural solutions for various applications. Their primary focus is on ensuring that structures are safe, durable, and capable of withstanding loads and environmental conditions.Key responsibilities of a Structural Applications Engineer may include:Designing and analyzing structures: They create structural designs using engineering principles and software tools, considering factors like materials, loads, and safety regulations.Conducting feasibility studies: Before starting a project, they assess the feasibility of structural designs, considering factors such as budget, timeline, and available resources.Collaborating with architects and other engineers: They work closely with architects, civil engineers, and other professionals to integrate structural elements into overall building designs.Selecting materials: They choose appropriate materials for construction based on factors such as strength, durability, and cost-effectiveness.Performing structural calculations: They calculate loads, stresses, and strains on structures to ensure they meet safety standards and performance requirements.Developing construction plans and specifications: They create detailed plans and specifications for construction crews to follow during the building process.Conducting site inspections: They visit construction sites to inspect ongoing work, ensure compliance with design specifications, and address any issues that arise.Providing technical support: They offer technical assistance to project teams, contractors, and clients throughout the construction process.Keeping abreast of industry trends and regulations: They stay updated on advancements in structural engineering technology, building codes, and industry standards.Overall, a Structural Applications Engineer plays a crucial role in the successful design and implementation of various structures, including buildings, and other infrastructure projects. They combine technical expertise with creative problem-solving to deliver safe and efficient structural solutions.Minimum Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Engineering required (Structural, Civil or Mechanical)Current EIT or ability to obtain within 9 monthsMinimum three years’ experience in the building products industryMust be self-motivated, creative, and willing to learn and adaptAbility to read and interpret architectural and structural drawings and the integration of the façade to the structureSelection Criteria:Strong written and verbal communication skillsProficiency utilizing computer resources to maximize effectiveness and efficiencyAbility to work effectively in a team environmentDemonstrated ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple time sensitive tasks and projectsExemplify a “Can Do Attitude” Preferences:Licensed PE

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple time sensitive tasks and projects

Keeping abreast of industry trends and regulations

Strong written and verbal communication skills, Proficiency utilizing computer resources to maximize effectiveness and efficiency, Ability to work effectively in a team environment, Demonstrated ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple time sensitive tasks and projects, Exemplify a “Can Do Attitude”
